# Mastra Agent Skills

Official agent skills for coding agents working with the [Mastra AI framework](https://mastra.ai).

## Installation

```bash
npx skills add mastra-ai/skills
```

## Included Skills

### ðŸ“š mastra-embedded-docs-look-up

Look up Mastra API signatures from embedded documentation in `node_modules/@mastra/*/dist/docs/`. Ensures docs match installed version.

### âœ¨ mastra

Comprehensive guide for building AI applications with Mastra. Includes 27+ production-ready code patterns for agents, workflows, memory, tools, storage, and RAG. Covers troubleshooting, v1 migration, and best practices.

### ðŸš€ create-mastra

Setup guide for new or existing projects. Includes installation, configuration, framework integration, and troubleshooting.

---

## Manual Installation

```bash
git clone https://github.com/mastra-ai/skills.git
```

Then configure your coding agent to load skills from the cloned directory.

---

## Contributing

Contributions welcome!

1. Fork the repository
2. Make improvements to SKILL.md files
3. Test with actual development workflows
4. Submit a pull request

---

- [Mastra GitHub](https://github.com/mastra-ai/mastra)
- [Agent Skills Spec](https://agentskills.io)

# Infinite Moves

Multiple loops for infinite task generation and execution.

## Why "Infinite"?

Most agent loops work like this:

```
Get task â†’ Execute â†’ Verify â†’ Repeat â†’ Stop (backlog empty)
```

They execute a predefined backlog until it's empty. **Infinite Moves is different** - it generates its own work:

```
â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
â”‚                                                   â”‚
â”‚   Ideation â”€â”€â”€â†’ Execution â”€â”€â”€â†’ Debt Sweep         â”‚
â”‚       â†‘               â”‚             â”‚             â”‚
â”‚       â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜             â”‚
â”‚                                                   â”‚
â”‚   The loops feed each other. Work never ends.     â”‚
â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
```

| Aspect | Typical Agent Loop | Infinite Moves |
|--------|-------------------|----------------|
| Work source | Predefined backlog | Self-generated via ideation |
| Loops | 1 (execution) | 3 (ideation, execution, debt) |
| Ends when | Backlog empty | Never - ideates more work |
| Maintenance | Manual | Self-maintaining via debt sweep |

**Ideation** scans docs, code, and your ideas to generate tasks. **Execution** works through them. **Debt sweep** keeps quality high. When the backlog runs low, ideation finds more. It's perpetual, self-sustaining development.

## Supported Platforms

| Platform | Location | Status |
|----------|----------|--------|
| **Claude Code** | `skills/` + `plugins/` | âœ“ Full support |
| **OpenCode** | `opencode/` | âœ“ Full support |

See platform-specific READMEs for installation instructions.

## Architecture (Claude Code)

Two components working together:

| Component | Purpose |
|-----------|---------|
| **Skill** | Makes Claude aware of the plugin, enables autonomous invocation |
| **Plugin** | Provides the commands and agents |

```
User: "Help me with my backlog"
        â†“
Skill activates (matches "backlog")
        â†“
Claude knows to use /moves commands
        â†“
Invokes /moves status, /moves run automatically
        â†“
Spawns task-executor agents
```

## Commands

| Command | Purpose |
|---------|---------|
| `/moves run` | Execute tasks (single, parallel, continuous) |
| `/moves ideate` | Generate tasks from topics or gap analysis |
| `/moves status` | View pipeline, manage tasks |
| `/moves sweep` | Scan for technical debt |

## Quick Start

```bash
# Initialize the data directory
mkdir -p .infinite-moves/tasks .infinite-moves/designs
echo '{"tasks": []}' > .infinite-moves/manifest.json

# Let Claude work autonomously
"Generate tasks for user authentication and start working on them"

# Or use commands explicitly
/moves ideate --topic "user authentication"
/moves run --continuous --parallel 2
```

## Data Directory

All artifacts are stored in `.infinite-moves/` at the project root:

```
.infinite-moves/
â”œâ”€â”€ manifest.json           # Task manifest
â”œâ”€â”€ tasks/                  # Task spec files
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ G17-health-sync.md
â”œâ”€â”€ designs/                # Design docs from ideation
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ push-notifications.md
â”œâ”€â”€ debt-manifest.json      # Technical debt tracking
â””â”€â”€ debt-report.md          # Human-readable debt report
```

## Structure

```
infinite-moves/
â”‚
â”œâ”€â”€ skills/infinite-moves/          # Claude Code skill

â”‚

â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ status.md

â”‚       â””â”€â”€ verifier.md
â”‚
â””â”€â”€ opencode/                       # OpenCode support
    â”œâ”€â”€ README.md

```

## The Loops

**Ideation Loop**
- Generate from topic: design doc â†’ tasks
- Gap analysis: docs vs code â†’ tasks
- Code scan: TODOs, untested code â†’ tasks

**Execution Loop**
- Pick highest priority available
- Execute (or spawn agent)
- Verify build
- Update manifest, purge completed

**Debt Loop**
- Scan for complexity, TODOs, type issues
- Track in debt manifest
- Auto-fix trivial items during continuous runs
